Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Faulty \Fault"y\, a. 1. Containing faults, blemishes, or defects; imperfect; not fit for the use intended. [1913 Webster]
Created once So goodly and erect, though faulty since. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
2. Guilty of a fault, or of faults; hence, blamable; worthy of censure. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
The king doth speak . . . as one which is faulty. --2 Sam. xiv. 13. [1913 Webster]
faulty adj. Non-functional; buggy. Same denotation as {bletcherous}, {losing}, q.v., but the connotation is much milder.
faulty adj 1: characterized by errors; "he submitted a faulty report" 2: having a defect; "I returned the appliance because it was defective" [syn: {defective}] [also: {faultiest}, {faultier}]
